title.value: Add a local printer as network printer

body.value:
If a printer is not installed via LAN in a network, but locally via USB or Centronics cable at a Linux computer you can allow other computers in the network to access to this printer.
Therefore the CUPS (Common Unix Printing System) must be installed – it is part of Lubuntu repository.
Go to the computer, which is linked to the printer:
Open the web browser and type the address http://localhost:631
Allow printer access
On page http://localhost:631/admin/ tick at “Share printers connected to this system”.
Alternatively use this command in a terminal: cupsctl –share-printers (Enter)
Select on page ”printer” the connected printer.
Click in menu “administration” on “printer”.
Leave “actual connection” unchanged → Proceed → add a tick to “allow access to this printer / share”;
optional: Add a name for the place of installation → proceed → change printer.
Show printer on other computers in the network (has to be done on each computer in the network)
To show the printer on all computers in the network → http://localhost:631/admin → tick “Show printers shared by other systems” → Change settings → acknowledge, ready.
Alternatively run in a terminal: cupsctl --remote-printers (Enter)
After this you should see the printer in the menu “printer”. Maybe you have to wait a while before the printer is shown or re-load the page.
